intro: Ecbolium vellasquezii, commonly known as the Vellasquez's ecbolium, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
